answers.answer: Human trafficking is a form of modern slavery and human rights violation involving the recruitment, transportation, transfer, harbouring or receipt of persons by means of threats, use of force, or psychological pressure for the purpose of further exploitation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What is human trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Exploitation can take various forms including labour exploitation or forced services, sexual exploitation, involvement in criminal activities, forced begging, domestic servitude, illegal adoption, organ removal, slavery or practices similar to slavery, and forced marriage.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What is human trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Signs include being offered an unrealistically high salary, forced work, services or sex without consent, withholding of personal documents or communication devices, imposition of strict rules, restricted movement, demands for debt repayment through labor or sex acts, or non-payment/underpayment for work.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Signs which may indicate you are or could be exploited by a person claiming to help you'.

answers.answer: Individuals can limit their vulnerability by knowing their rights, maintaining possession of their documents, staying in touch with trusted people, gathering detailed information about travel and accommodation to share, and developing a secret 'safeword' with trusted contacts.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What can you do to limit your vulnerability to trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Suspicions of human trafficking can be reported to TELVERDE ANITIP 0800.800.678 (in Romania), eLiberare Crisis Textline 0757.749.845, National Emergency Number 112, or the free national anti-trafficking hotline for migrants 527 (calls from Ukraine), or by seeking refuge in a public place.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided information states that any suspicion of human trafficking can be reported, but it does not specify particular conditions or timings for when to report.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Sexual exploitation is defined as any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust for sexual purposes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Reporting sexual exploitation and abuse commited by humanitarian workers'.

answers.answer: Suspected sexual exploitation or abuse by UNHCR, UN, or NGO staff can be reported directly to UNHCR Romania at inspector@unhcr.org. The report should include details of what happened, who committed the alleged wrongdoing, and when and where the incident occurred.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Report suspected sexual exploitation and abuse'.

answers.answer: Parents can prepare their child for different scenarios by packing a 'safety backpack,' discussing important points to minimize stress, having an action plan, and using conversation guides that cover basic safeguards against human trafficking and online exploitation vulnerabilities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Children’s security'.

answers.answer: Through Sprijin de Urgență, individuals can request or provide resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Individuals can access Un Acoperiș to find support in securing temporary accommodation or to offer a space to help vulnerable people coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: If someone ends up in an exploitation situation, help is available through the Romanian National Anti-trafficking Helpline (0800.800.678 / +4021.313.31.00), National Emergency Number (112), the national anti-trafficking hotline for migrants (527 from Ukraine), or by seeking refuge in a public place.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Suggestions to seek help'.

answers.answer: A guide for children, like the one created by eLiberare and UNICEF, serves as a conversation guide between parents and children, covering basic safeguards against human trafficking and online exploitation vulnerabilities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Children’s security'.
